qas.question: bassett focuses on what to illustrate his idea?

answers.text: the role of nineteenth-century maps during the "scramble for Africa"

qas.question: What provided an incentive to western empires to colonize Africa?

answers.text: fill in blank spaces on contemporary maps

qas.question: What were blank spaces used for on nineteenth-century maps?

answers.text: to denote unknown or unexplored territory

qas.question: What did Basset analyze before coming to his conclusions?
Who besides the british colonized Africa?
bassett doesn't focus on what to illustrate his idea?

plausible_answers.text: blank space to denote unknown or unexplored territory

qas.question: What provided an incentive to eastern empires to colonize Africa?
What did Basset analyze after coming to his conclusions?
Who besides the british colonized Asia?

context: To better illustrate this idea, Bassett focuses his analysis of the role of nineteenth-century maps during the "scramble for Africa". He states that maps "contributed to empire by promoting, assisting, and legitimizing the extension of French and British power into West Africa". During his analysis of nineteenth-century cartographic techniques, he highlights the use of blank space to denote unknown or unexplored territory. This provided incentives for imperial and colonial powers to obtain "information to fill in blank spaces on contemporary maps".
